newsitem.title: CANADA: Canadian dollar closes firmer on one big buy.
newsitem.headline: Canadian dollar closes firmer on one big buy.

text.p: * Canada's dollar closed firmer at C$1.3536 (US$0.7443) from Tuesday's close of C$1.3452 (US$0.7434) in active trading, dealers said.
* They said most of the move came through one huge commercial buyer in the United States. * Trading was active after the Bank of Canada did not cut rates as expected.
The market has speculated about a rate cut for the past few days because of recent weak economic data.

Interest rates have fallen twice this month, but traders believe the poor data combined with a strong currency will lure the Bank of Canada to cut rates again in an attempt to revive the Canadian economy.
The overall tone of the currency was strong, dealers said.
On the crosses, the Canadian dollar slid to 1.1327 marks from Tuesday's 1.1336 marks but rose to 84.04 yen from 83.44 yen.
